com.googlecode.jaks.system

Class Subprocess

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<String>
          • com.googlecode.jaks.system.Subprocess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<String>, Collection<String>, List<String>, RandomAccess

    public class Subprocess
extends ArrayList<String>
    Subprocess lets you launch an external process, optionally passing stdin data to the process, and optionally receiving stdout data from the process. A number of different versions of call() are available, letting you deal with the data directly in whatever form is most convenient for you (String, byte, or streaming). It's like Process, only a lot easier.
    Author:
    Jason Smith
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • execute

        public int execute(InputStream stdin,
          OutputStream stdout,
          OutputStream stderr)
            throws Exception
        Executes a command, waiting for it to finish.

        If stdout or stderr are not specified, they default to System.out and System.err, respectively. If stdin is not defined, it defaults to null.

        Parameters:
        command - The command to execute.
        stdin - stdin Available for the process to read.
        stdout - stdout From the process (defaults to System.out if null).
        stderr - stderr From the process (defaults to System.err if null).
        Returns:
        The exit code from the process.
        Throws:
        IOException - See IOException.
        Exception

      • newShutdownHandler

        protected Subprocess.AbstractShutdownHandler newShutdownHandler(Process process)
        Provides the shutdown handler. The default implementation is Subprocess.DefaultShutdownHandlerImpl. Override this method to modify the shutdown.
        Parameters:
        process - The associated process.
        Returns:
        The shutdown handler.
